channel.title: CVE Feed for gogs -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for gogs -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-1986|2024-08-03T00:24:44.142Z -- gogs -- gogs%2Fgogs
item.description: OS Command Injection in GitHub repository gogs/gogs prior to 0.12.9.

item.title: CVE-2022-31038|2024-08-03T07:03:40.294Z -- gogs -- gogs
item.description: Gogs is an open source self-hosted Git service. In versions of gogs prior to 0.12.9 `DisplayName` does not filter characters input from users, which leads to an XSS vulnerability when directly displayed in the issue list. This issue has been resolved in commit 155cae1d which sanitizes `DisplayName` prior to display to the user. All users of gogs are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade should check their users' display names for malicious characters.

item.title: CVE-2022-2024|2024-08-03T00:24:44.184Z -- gogs -- gogs%2Fgogs
item.description: OS Command Injection in GitHub repository gogs/gogs prior to 0.12.11.

item.title: CVE-2022-32174|2024-08-03T07:32:55.973Z -- gogs -- gogs
item.description: In Gogs, versions v0.6.5 through v0.12.10 are vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) that leads to an account takeover.
